intro: Lampranthus sparsiflorus, commonly known as the sparseflowered lampranthus, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its diverse and often colorful flora. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. Its flowers are typically bright red or orange, appearing in late spring to early summer. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
